text: First, we note that the possible residues of a cube modulo 9 are 0, 1, and 8.
class-1-reason: This paragraph sets up a planned approach to solving the problem by establishing possible cube residues and calculating the residues of the right-hand side. It follows a systematic method without exploration or verification.

text: We then compute the residues of the right-hand side \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) modulo 9 for all \( n \) from 0 to 8:
class-1-reason: This paragraph sets up a planned approach to solving the problem by establishing possible cube residues and calculating the residues of the right-hand side. It follows a systematic method without exploration or verification.
class-2-reason: The sentence specifies the plan to compute residues under modulo 9 for different n values.

text: - For \( n \equiv 0, 2, 3, 5, 6, 8 \pmod{9} \), the right-hand side \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) is congruent to 7 modulo 9.
class-1-reason: Here, computations are systematically carried out for different values of n modulo 9, following the established method, which is a continuation of the structured plan.
class-2-reason: The sentence computes specific cases for n modulo 9, giving the outcome of the expression for these cases.

text: - For \( n \equiv 1, 4, 7 \pmod{9} \), the right-hand side \( 3n^2 + 3n + 7 \) is congruent to 4 modulo 9.
class-1-reason: Here, computations are systematically carried out for different values of n modulo 9, following the established method, which is a continuation of the structured plan.
class-2-reason: This sentence continues the computation for remaining cases of n modulo 9, giving specific outcomes.

text: Since the residues 4 and 7 modulo 9 are not among the possible residues of a cube (0, 1, 8), there is a contradiction.

class-2-reason: The sentence describes the contradiction found as a result of analysis comparing the possible residues.
